title: Night of Hate Comments episode cancelled after Sulli dies by suspected suicide
text:
Sulli was one of four MCs on Night Of Hate Comments (Picture: JTBC)

Night of Hate Comments’ upcoming episode has been cancelled following the death of Sulli.

The 25-year-old was found dead at her home in Seongnam on Monday, with police working off the assumption that she took her own life.

Sulli was one of the four permanent MCs on the JTBC show, and in respect of the former f(x) star, JTBC has cancelled the upcoming episode on 18 October.

The channel said: ‘We express our deepest regrets about the sad news regarding Sulli, who appeared on Night of Hate Comments as an MC.

‘The broadcast scheduled for October 18 is cancelled. May she rest in peace.’

It is unclear whether other pre-recorded episodes will be aired over the coming weeks.

Night of Hate Comments premiered in June and saw Sulli, Shin Dong Yup, Kim Sook, Kim Jong Min and a celebrity guest facing malicious comments head-on by reading them on the show and responding to them directly.

Sulli – who previously went on hiatus from f(x) after admitting to struggling with trolling – discussed how she learned not to worry about what others were saying about her.

Speaking on the show, she explained: ‘I think that if I worry too much about what other people think of me, then it will be too difficult to find my own self. Because I would get influenced by everyone. I do work at it, but ever since I was young, I hated seeing myself obsess about what others thought of me.

Sulli is suspected to have taken her own life (Picture: EPA/YONHAP)

‘Years ago, I was practicing dance in the practice room. It was so tiring that everyone began dancing half-heartedly. But then someone who was high up in the company came to the room to watch. Everyone started working really hard. Even though just a few minutes ago, they were just going through the motions, they suddenly started working hard. I hated seeing that. So I kept dancing half-heartedly.’

Sulli, real name Choi Jin-ri, also addressed the abuse she would get when she posted pictures in which she wasn’t wearing a bra under her top.

The Goblin singer said: ‘Going braless is one’s freedom.

‘Bras have wires; they are not good for health. Not wearing one is comfortable. That is something beautiful and natural. For me, a bra is like an accessory. Some outfits go with it, and others do not. That’s why I sometimes do not wear a bra.

‘When I upload my photos without a bra, people talk about it a lot. I could have been scared. But I didn’t because I thought it would be nice if more people could discard their prejudices. I want to step outside the box, tell people (not wearing a bra) is not a big thing.’

While JTBC have cancelled Night of Hate Comments, a number of K-pop artists have also suspended their activities in light of Sulli’s death, including SuperM, Super Junior and Sulli’s former bandmate Amber Liu.
